CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the HR Interview stage positioned above or below the Technical Interview stage?
SRP.A: The HR Interview stage is positioned {above} the Technical Interview stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {exponential} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Application Submitted?
VE.A: The value of stage Application Submitted is {100%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Phone Screen?
VE.A: The value of stage Phone Screen is {73%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage HR Interview?
VE.A: The value of stage HR Interview is {59%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Application Submitted, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Offer Accepted, with a value of {20%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage HR Interview to stage Technical Interview?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage HR Interview to stage Technical Interview is {15%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Offer Extended to stage Offer Accepted?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Offer Extended to stage Offer Accepted is {3%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 66%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Application Submitted} stage has {100%}, the {Phone Screen} stage has {73%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 21%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 33% and 66%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {HR Interview} stage has {59%}, the {Technical Interview} stage has {44%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Technical Interview to Offer Extended, or from stage HR Interview to Technical Interview?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Technical Interview} to {Offer Extended} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage HR Interview to Technical Interview, or from stage Phone Screen to HR Interview?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {HR Interview} to {Technical Interview} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Offer Extended to Offer Accepted, from stage Application Submitted to Phone Screen, or from stage Technical Interview to Offer Extended?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Application Submitted} to stage {Phone Screen} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Application Submitted} and {Phone Screen} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Offer Extended} and {Offer Accepted} stages.
